channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: RFK Jr. Wants to Link Antidepressants Like SSRIs to Mass Shootings. Experts Aren’t Buying It
item.description: Studies show that people who commit mass shootings aren't more likely to be taking antidepressants. But is RFK Jr. paying any attention?

item.title: I Ditched Alexa and Upgraded My Smart Home
item.description: If you're spending more time fixing your smart home than using it, it could be time to stop relying on the cloud. Here's how.

item.title: Scotland vs Argentina live streams: How to watch Autumn International 2025 live from Murrayfield
item.description: Here's how to watch Scotland vs Argentina live streams from wherever you are in the world, as the Scots look to bounce back after losing to New Zealand.

item.title: Should you stop charging your phone battery to 100%? Here’s what experts say
item.description: We’ve all heard that charging your phone to 100% can damage the battery, but is that true? Experts explain what really happens.

item.title: How to watch Hungary vs Ireland: Free streams, TV Channels and preview for 2026 World Cup Qualifier showdown
item.description: We'll show you all the ways you can watch Hungary vs Ireland in Group F this Sunday from across the globe, including free options for this Group F clash.

item.title: The best early Black Friday iPhone deals: here's how to get a free iPhone 17, iPad, or a super cheap plan
item.description: The biggest discounts, plus some buying advice for our readers

item.title: AI is killing privacy. We can’t let that happen
item.description: In the age of AI, data won’t just reflect who we are, but will help shape who we become. To take back control, remember a centuries-old invention. In a perfect world, my job wouldn’t exist. I’m a consumer privacy advocate, which means I spend my days fighting for something that should be automatic: your right to control and protect your own personal information....

item.title: Ford gets a huge new headquarters for an ambitious new era
item.description: Goodbye, silos and desk-bound culture. Hello, 2.1 million square feet of collaborative workspace, design studios, and outdoor courtyards—designed to flex to an industry changing at warp speed. After more than 70 years, the Ford Motor Co. finally has an architectural centerpiece.

item.title: Toutes les couleurs de l’USB, l’ambitieuse Steam Machine et la grosse mise à jour Pixel Drop – L’actu tech de la semaine
item.description: Les couleurs des ports USB n'ont plus de secrets, Valve défie les consoles avec sa nouvelle Steam Machine, Google muscle ses smartphones Pixel avec l'IA. Voici le récapitulatif des articles les plus lus sur Frandroid.

item.title: Is Waymo Ready for the Icy Streets of Detroit and Denver? It Had Better Be, Because It’s Coming
item.description: Buckle up. Autonomous vehicle technology is moving to locales less-than-ideal conditions.

item.title: Boulanger brade un pack Xiaomi 15T Pro avec deux accessoires en cadeau, merci le pré-Black Friday
item.description: Un pack qui aligne le luxueux et polyvalent Xiaomi 15T, accompagné de deux complices bien choisis : les Redmi Buds 6 Active pour la bande-son, et le Smart Band 9 Active pour le style et le cardio. Trois appareils qui se serrent les coudes et atterrissent en pré-Black Friday avec un tarif qui passe de 999 euros à 749 euros chez Boulanger.

item.title: Nvidia : encore une mise à jour majeure pour Shield TV
item.description: Nvidia continue de bichonner sa Shield TV, malgré les années et la priorité tournée vers l'IA. Le constructeur a déployé une nouvelle mise à jour logicielle qui ne se contente pas d’ajuster quelques détails techniques.

item.title: Quelles sont les meilleures montres connectées de 2025 ?
item.description: Vous voulez craquer sur une smartwatch ? Galaxy Watch, Pixel Watch, Apple Watch, Garmin ou encore Withings. Voici notre sélection des meilleures montres connectées testées par notre rédaction pour accompagner votre smartphone Android ou votre iPhone.

item.title: Readers Choice Awards 2025: Your favorite smart home brands
item.description: Mashable surveyed its readers about the smart home products they use. See which smart home brands earned a Readers' Choice Award.

item.title: Need a cheap camera gift idea? My top pick is a personalized Camp Snap retro compact
item.description: Camp Snap's fabulous digital reimagining of the single-use film camera is available in multiple colorways and now you can add your name of choice to one – it's a neat gift idea for budding creatives.

item.title: How to refresh your Hinge account
item.description: Instructions on how to use Hinge's Fresh Start feature

item.title: Give your old PC a total refresh for under $10
item.description: Make an old PC feel new again for just $9.97 with this Microsoft Windows 11 Pro license through tonight at 11:59 p.m. PT.

item.title: This $440 MacBook Pro usually costs almost $2,000
item.description: This 2020 MacBook Pro is now on sale for $439.99.

item.title: A new AI platform is giving lifetime access to ChatGPT, Gemini, and more
item.description: 1min.AI is an AI platform that gives you lifetime access to many of the most popular AI models

item.title: Your favorite smart lights: TP-Link is a Mashable Readers Choice Award winner
item.description: TP-Link (Kasa) has won a Mashable Readers' Choice Award, based on results from our Smartest Home survey.

item.title: Philips Hue is a Readers Choice Award winner: Why readers like the smart light brand
item.description: We surveyed Mashable readers on the smart home they use and love. The results are in, and Philips Hue has won a Mashable Readers' Choice Award.

item.title: iRobot Roomba is your favorite robot vacuum brand, survey says
item.description: We asked Mashable readers about their favorite smart home devices, including robot vacuums. They crowned Roomba a winner.

item.title: Amazons Alexa is a Mashable Readers Choice Award winner
item.description: We surveyed Mashable readers on their favorite smart home devices. Alexa is a winner among smart assistants.

item.title: Mashable readers crowned Google Assistant as their favorite smart home assistant
item.description: In Mashable's Readers' Choice Smartest Home survey, participants dubbed Google Assistant the best smart assistant in overall satisfaction and likelihood to recommend.

item.title: Blink is a Mahable Readers Choice Award winner: What our readers said about the security camera brand
item.description: Mashable readers rated Blink highest in overall satisfaction for home security cameras. Read their thoughts.

item.title: Readers Choice Smartest Home: Your favorite vacuum brands
item.description: We surveyed our readers on the smart home tech they use. In the vacuum space, both Dyson and iRobot scored highly among our readers.

item.title: Readers Choice Smartest Home: Your favorite smart lights
item.description: Our readers' favorite smart light brands include TP-Link (Kasa) and Philips Hue. See the full results of our Readers' Choice Smartest Home survey.

item.title: Readers Choice: The battle of the smart home assistants
item.description: We surveyed our readers about their favorite smart home devices, including which smart assistants they use and love.

item.title: Readers Choice: Your favorite smart security cameras
item.description: Find out which security cameras our readers trust to protect their homes. Winners include Blink, Ring, and Wyze.

item.title: The Harvard Endowment’s Biggest Public Investment is Now Bitcoin
item.description: The endowment dramatically increased its holdings of a spot bitcoin ETF since its previous such report.

item.title: Google alerte sur ces 6 arnaques en ligne qui font des ravages
item.description: À l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année, les arnaques en ligne explosent à la hausse. Google a identifié les six menaces majeures qui planent sur les internautes fin 2025. Des fausses offres d'emploi aux VPN malveillants, en passant par les escroqueries à l'IA, les pirates ne manquent pas d'ingéniosité.
